<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Query the Setup Config server for installs, then pick the newest version</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and find its default VC toolchain. If &#96;VCToolsVersion&#96; is specified, that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// version is preferred over the latest version.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the preferred way to discover new Visual Studios, as they&#39;re no</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// longer listed in the registry.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a79c3f6c8d0e321d8b23f365e485bfde7">findVCToolChainViaSetupConfig</a>(vfs::FileSystem &amp;VFS,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Look in the registry for Visual Studio installs, and use that to get</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a toolchain path. VS2017 and newer don&#39;t get added to the registry.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So if we find something here, we know that it&#39;s an older version.</span></CodeLine>
